meanings.definition: In the direction of a lake.
meanings.sent1: The boat sailed lakeward, towards the calm waters.
meanings.sent2: She looked lakeward, admiring the beautiful view of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The ducks waddled lakeward, eager to reach the water for a swim.
meanings.sent4: The sun set lakeward, casting a golden glow over the rippling lake.
meanings.sent5: The children skipped lakeward, excited to play by the shore.

meanings.definition: Moving or facing towards a lake.
meanings.sent1: The lakeward path led us to the peaceful lake.
meanings.sent2: Their house had a lakeward view, perfect for watching sunsets.
meanings.sent3: The lakeward breeze carried the scent of water and fresh air.
meanings.sent4: The lakeward side of the cabin had a stunning panorama of the lake.
meanings.sent5: The lakeward hill sloped gently down to the sparkling lake below.
